metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15393 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
In the Linux kernel 4.4 through 5.7.6, usbtest_disconnect indrivers/usb/misc/usbtest.c has a memory leak, aka CID-28ebeb8db770.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15393` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-115.116
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-115.116
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-115.116
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-115.116
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-115.116
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.3.0-65-generic - 5.3.0-65.59

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-115.116').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.3.0-65.59').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1072.73').
